Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) can, in principle, directly use hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Direct hydrocarbon utilization in microtubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, nickel-stabilized zirconia anode deteriorated rapidly under direct butane utilization due to carbon deposition.
Titulo: Direct hydrocarbon utilization in microtubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The cracking rate is faster, when carbon number is larger and straight chain is longer in methane, propane, i-butane and n-butane.
Titulo: Direct hydrocarbon utilization in microtubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, microtubular SOFCs with nickel-gadolinia doped ceria (Ni-GDC) anode can generate power continuously at 650 degrees C over a period of 100 h in propane and butane, because the Ni-GDC has high catalytic activities of hydrocarbon reforming and carbon oxidation.
Titulo: Direct hydrocarbon utilization in microtubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The Ni-GDC is one of the desirable anodes for direct propane and butane utilization in SOFCs.
Titulo: Direct hydrocarbon utilization in microtubular solid oxide fuel cells
